templates.prompt: Use linear to make a brief sprint plan doc for next 2 weeks

templates.title: Overnight Updates
templates.description: Update me on overnight Slack/email messages
templates.prompt: Update me on overnight Slack/email messages

templates.title: Follow-Up Email Automation
templates.description: Automatically send follow-up emails to leads
templates.prompt: Follow up when my customers reply to outbound emails. Make it so if I get a reply AI handles everything

templates.title: Inbound Lead Qualification
templates.description: Qualify inbound leads automatically
templates.prompt: Automatically score demo requests, only route qualified prospects to my sales team in Slack. Demo requests come in with the subject DEMO REQUEST
templates.example_output:
To request access to Zendesk, follow these steps:

**Identify the need**
• Make sure Zendesk access is required for your job responsibilities and prepare a business justification.

**Check existing access**
• Confirm with your team or IT whether you already have access based on your role or group membership.

**Submit a formal request**
• Email your IT team with the business justification or a clear explanation of why you need Zendesk access.

Once reviewed and approved, access will be granted according to internal guidelines.

**Suggested next action for you:**

Would you like to gain a new support request for Zendesk access or ask a follow-up question?
templates.agent_workflow:
flowchart TD
    A["Gmail: DEMO REQUEST Email Arrives"]
    B["Extract Lead Info"]
    C["Search Google Drive/Knowledge Base for Criteria"]
    D["Score Lead"]
    F{"Is Lead Qualified?"}
    E["Log in Google Sheet (all leads)"]
    G["Send Slack Message to Sales Team (qualified only)"]

    %% Output nodes
    O1["Google Sheet: Lead + Score (all leads)"]
    O2["Slack: Qualified Lead Notification"]

    %% Workflow
    A --> B
    B --> C
    C --> D
    D --> F
    F -- Yes --> G
    F -- No --> E
    G --> E
    E --> O1
    G --> O2

templates.title: Content Calendar

templates.title: Automated Job Updates
templates.description: Execute a complete job application workflow using parallel agents to find, analyze, and apply to tech opportunities
templates.prompt: Execute the following comprehensive job application workflow USING PARALLEL AGENTS:/n/n1. GitHub Jobs Repository Analysis/nScrape and analyze job postings from https://github.com/SimplifyJobs/Summer2026-Internships ONLY - NO OTHER WEBSITE OR LISTING/nLook through the repositories tagged with "jobs" topic to find active job boards and listings/nFocus on {{backend/frontend/fullstack/machine learning}} roles/nSearch for jobs posted in the last 24-48 hours across these job repositories/nPrioritize remote-friendly positions and companies with strong engineering cultures/n/n2. Resume & Cover Letter Analysis/nSearch my Google Drive for my resume and cover letter documents/nAnalyze my background, skills, experience, and project history from the resume/nIdentify the top 5 jobs from the GitHub job repositories that best match my qualifications/nConsider factors like: required tech stack, experience level, company size, role responsibilities/nFor each of the 5 selected jobs, customize my cover letter template to highlight relevant experience, projects, and skills that align with the specific role requirements/n/n3. Recruiter Research & Email Drafting/nFor each of the 5 selected companies, use people search to find:/n* Engineering recruiters or technical talent acquisition specialists/n* Hiring managers for the specific teams/roles/n* Engineering managers or team leads who might be involved in hiring/nDraft personalized outreach emails that:/n* Reference the specific GitHub job posting/n* Highlight relevant technical skills and projects/n* Include customized cover letter and resume attachments/n* Show genuine interest in the company's tech stack and mission/n/n4. Alumni Network Research & Email Drafting/nFor each target company, search for alumni from {{university}} currently working there/nFocus on people in engineering, product, data science, or technical leadership roles - Draft personalized networking emails that:/n* Mention our shared educational background/n* Express genuine interest in learning about the company culture and engineering practices/n* Ask for informational interviews or insights about the team/role/n* Keep the tone professional but friendly, focusing on learning rather than direct job asks/n/n5. Daily Newsletter & Notification System/nCompile all findings into a comprehensive daily newsletter including:/n* Summary of 5 selected jobs with company details, role descriptions, and GitHub links/n* Technical requirements and how they match my background/n* Recruiter/hiring manager contact information with draft emails ready to send/n* Alumni contacts found with networking email drafts/n* Application deadlines and priority rankings/n* Next steps and recommended actions for each opportunity/nSend the newsletter email to myself, no formatting or extra graphics - just line breaks, with subject "Daily GitHub Jobs Update - [Date]"/nSEND A TEXT MESSAGE NOTIFICATION: "Daily job hunt newsletter sent with 5 new opportunities from GitHub job!"/n/n6. Organization & Tracking/nCreate or update a Google Sheet titled "GitHub Jobs Tracker" with columns:/n* Date Found, Company, Role Title, GitHub Repo Link, Match Score (1-10)/n* Required Skills, Experience Level, Location/Remote Policy/n* Recruiter Name & Email, Alumni Contact, Application Status/n* Cover Letter Customized (Y/N), Emails Sent (Y/N), Follow-up Date/n* Notes and Next Steps/nColor-code rows based on priority and application status Focus on quality opportunities from the GitHub jobs ecosystem, prioritize companies with active open-source contributions, and maintain authentic, personalized communication throughout the process./n/n7. Maintenance/nOnce you create the Google Sheet, continue to reuse the EXACT SAME ONE for tracking all details - check Google Drive for any existing GitHub job spreadsheets/nDo not create a new one upon every execution, but instead just add to the same one/n/nFocus on quality opportunities from the GitHub jobs ecosystem, prioritize companies with active open-source contributions, and maintain authentic, personalized communication throughout the process./n/nENSURE TO USE PARALLEL AGENTS - DO THIS IN ONE PROMPT - DO NOT FORGET TO TEXT ME TOO

templates.title: Notes to Notion
templates.description: Convert notes, sheets, and papers to a Notion page
templates.prompt: i'm too tired to read through all my neuroscience notes - go through my neuroscience notes folder and create a summary of everything in a new notion page

templates.title: BioPharma Vendor Performance Tracking
templates.description: Track vendor status, metrics, quality of shipments, and more
templates.prompt: i need to update vendor performance scorecard based on latest emails from our manufacturing partners - analyze recent communications, extract the key performance data, update our tracking sheet with delivery dates and quality metrics, calculate risk scores for each vendor, and send me alerts of any vendors that need immediate attention

templates.title: Prep Before Team Meeting
templates.description: Quickly prepare before meetings using your knowledge base
templates.prompt: schedule a meeting with the engineering team for next week to discuss q4 roadmap, send calendar invites, and create a pre-meeting agenda doc with talking points

templates.title: Find Strategic Partners
templates.description: Use your knowledge base to quickly find next logical strategic partners and automatically draft personalized outreach emails
templates.prompt: can you find 5 strategic partners in san francisco and create a gsheet with their information, as well as email drafts to each company

templates.title: Sales Optimization
templates.description: Optimize sales operations through previous metrics, meeting patterns, and top performing emails
templates.prompt: @gsheets pull monthly sales metrics, @gcal analyze meeting patterns, @gmail find top performing emails

templates.title: Sales Objection Training
templates.description: Use previous deal data to anticipate objections in sales calls and create material to train your team
templates.prompt: I need you to analyze this lost deal data and create a comprehensive objection handling training system. Here's what I want you to do: 1) Analyze the patterns - identify the most common objections, which reps struggle with what, and any industry-specific trends 2) Create objection handling scripts - generate specific, actionable responses for each major objection type 3) Build role-play scenarios - use the actual lost prospects to create realistic training scenarios 4) Design personalized training plans - create specific coaching recommendations for each sales rep 5) Generate coaching materials - include practice exercises and success metrics. Make everything specific to our actual data, not generic advice.

templates.title: Blog Posts from Content Calendar
templates.description: Use your Notion content calendar to automatically create blog posts and notify your team
templates.prompt: @notion get our content calendar for next week, @gdocs create draft blog posts for each topic, @gmail send drafts to the content team for review

templates.title: Personalized Profile Research
templates.description: Do deep research on certain profiles and find unique outreach angles
templates.prompt: find the vp of sales and director of marketing at stripe, get their linkedin profiles, work history, and contact information. summarize their backgrounds and suggest personalized outreach angles
